titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Cypress Hill Rifle Association photographs V1984.002
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Weatherly Stephan
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-28T14:17-0500

physdesc.extent: in one folder and one oversize box.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Cypress Hills Rifle Association photographs, V1984.002, Box number, Object ID number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Gift of Arthur Winnert, date unknown.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: Copyright will remain in effect for 120 years following the date of creation. All items in this collection will enter the public domain by 2032. For information on securing rights to publish or reproduce, please see the Brooklyn Historical Society Reproduction Rights Policy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Four mounted photographs, dated 1908 to 1912, from the Cypress Hills Rifle Association. The photographs show the association's shooting range, located in the Cypress Hills neighborhood of Brooklyn, as well as group portraits of members at events.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids note
otherfindaid.p: Item-level description and digital versions of images from the collection are available for searching via the image database in the library.
